name: Shoot All the Things
description:
This is a frustrating little space shooter that I modeled after the button-mashing days of my childhood visits to arcades.

Of all my games, I think this one is the one I'm most likely to come back to and improve upon over time- it was a lot of fun to make. The original concept had tight ship controls, but I think making the movement more momentum-based makes it more interesting.

This is yet another game made from the same Unity course as most of my other games: https://www.udemy.com/unitycourse/

Unfortunately for me, because I was following along in Unity 5, and this section of the course was taught in Unity 4, a TON of the methods demonstrated to do certain things got lost in translation, and I needed to come up with my own methods for doing about 50-60% of all the coding. So actually, this game is more mine than most of the other minigames I've made.

All sound effects were made using BFXR: http://www.bfxr.net/

Music is "Let's Apocalypse Later" by Artofescapism via Free Music Archive: http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Artofescapism_1629/Arena_Electronic_Music/Apoc...
